component.name: RadioGroup
component.description: Allow the user to select exactly one option from a visible set.

useCases: Only one option may be selected from a small set

commonPatterns.name: labeled-radio-group
commonPatterns.description: Standard vertical list of labeled radio options

commonPatterns.name: controlled-radio-group

antiPatterns.reason: Binary on/off states are better communicated by a Switch with immediate effect semantics

antiPatterns.scenario: Using RadioGroup when options are numerous
antiPatterns.reason: Long visible lists waste space and overwhelm the user
antiPatterns.alternative: Use Select for more than 5-6 options

antiPatterns.scenario: Using RadioGroup when user must search or filter
antiPatterns.reason: RadioGroup has no built-in search capability

slots.radio-group: Root container; renders as a vertical flex column with gap-2
slots.radio-group-item: Individual radio circle; renders the indicator dot when checked

parentConstraints: RadioGroupItem must be a direct child of RadioGroup

interactions.click: Selects the clicked radio item, deselects all others
interactions.keyboard: Arrow keys navigate between items; Space selects the focused item

accessibility.keyboardSupport: Arrow keys to move between options; Space to select; Tab to enter/exit group
accessibility.screenReader: Announces group label, each item label, and checked state
accessibility.focusManagement: Roving focus within group; focus ring visible on focus-visible

rules: All options must be visible at the same time
Selection is exclusive â€” only one option may be selected
Each RadioGroupItem must have an associated Label

aiHints.context: Use RadioGroup when comparison between a small number of options matters and all choices should be visible. For more than 5-6 options, prefer Select. For binary on/off, prefer Switch.
